page.title: 01 S.E.NORTHANTS.
page.content: This area in S.E.Northamptonshire,very close to the Buckinghamshire border is rural in character.In the segment being described there are two villages Denton in the N.E. corner lies on the A.428(T)road and Hackleton in the S.W.on the B.526. The whole area is covered by very heavy clay with here and there small outcrops of grit.The latter supports the small woodlands and copses while the former is used by farmers for crop growing,especially cereals and rape oil seed. The area is fairly flat and low lying(approximately 350 feet above sea-level) Two unclassified roads traverse from North to South, thus making communication between the two villages relatively easy.
